paragraphs.text: The Charlie Hebdo cartoonists were smarter theologians than the jihadis.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: Rather disturbingly, one word seems to connect the activity of the Paris terrorists and that of the Charlie Hebdo cartoonists: iconoclasm
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I say disturbingly, because pointing out some common ground may be seen as blurring the crucial distinction between murderous bastards and innocent satirists
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Nonetheless
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it strikes me as fascinating that the cartoonists were profoundly iconoclastic in their constant ridiculing of religion
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: (all religions, it must be noted)
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: yet it is precisely this same ancient tradition of iconoclasm that inspires Jews and Muslims to resist representational art and, in its most twisted pathological form, to attack the offices of a Paris magazine and slaughter those whose only weapon was the pen
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So what's the connection?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In one sense an iconoclast is someone who refuses the established view of things
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: who kicks out against cherished beliefs and institutions
paragraphs.label: common-ground

paragraphs.text: Which sounds pretty much like Charlie Hebdo
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But the word iconoclast also describes those religious people who refuse and smash representational images, especially of the divine
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The second of the Ten Commandments prohibits graven images
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: which is why there are no pictures of God in Judaism or Islam
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And theologically speaking, the reason they are deeply suspicious of divine representation is because they fear that such representations of God might get confused for the real thing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The danger, they believe, is that we might end up overinvesting in a bad copy, something that looks a lot like what we might think of as god
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: which, in reality, is just a human projection
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So much better then to smash all representations of the divine
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And yet this, of course, is exactly what Charlie Hebdo was doing
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: In the bluntest, rudest, most scatological and offensive of terms, Charlie Hebdo has been insisting that the images people worship are just human creations - bad and dangerous human creations
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And in taking the piss out of such images, they actually exist in a tradition of religious iconoclasts going back as far as Abraham taking a hammer to his father's statues
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Both are attacks on representations of the divine
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Which is why the terrorists, as well as being murderers, are theologically mistaken in thinking Charlie Hebdo is the enemy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: if God is fundamentally unrepresentable, then any representation of God is necessarily less than God and thus deserves to be fully and fearlessly attacked
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: what better way of doing this than through satire, like scribbling a little moustache on a grand statue of God
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It's only some Christians that might demur from this logic
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For the Christian story (ie Christmas) tells of God coming into the world as a human being
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: And in doing this the divine takes on a representational form
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Jesus, says St Paul, is the image of the invisible God
paragraphs.label: testimony

paragraphs.text: Without this the whole western tradition of Catholic religious art and eastern tradition of icons is utterly inconceivable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: So I can see how some Christians might find disrespectful images of God a la Charlie Hebdo insulting
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: After all
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they believe it's possible for images genuinely to capture something of God
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: if
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: images can't capture God- and that's the Jewish/Islamic position- then bring on the cartoonists
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They should be encouraged to do their worst and disrupt our confidence that what we think of as God bears any resemblance to anything legitimately God-like
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They are like Moses bringing down the golden calf
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It is the ancient job of the iconoclast
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: of course, these terrorists weren't really interested in theology
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: They thought that Charlie Hebdo's cartoonists were insulting their human tribe, a tribe they called fellow Muslims
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And maybe they were
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: whatever else was happening, it was the atheist cartoonists who were performing the religious function and the apparently believing Muslims who had forgotten their deepest religious insights
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: For any representation of the divine that leads people to murder each other deserves the maximum possible disrespect
paragraphs.label: assumption
